content:
Getting to the University of British Columbia (UBC) campus from Vancouver International Airport (YVR) is relatively easy. Here are a few options:

**1. Taxi:**
Taxis are readily available outside the airport terminals. The trip to UBC takes around 30-40 minutes, depending on traffic, and costs approximately $35-$40 CAD, plus tip.

**2. Uber/Lyft:**
Ride-hailing services are popular in Vancouver. You can find the pickup areas outside the airport terminals. The trip to UBC takes around 30-40 minutes, depending on traffic, and costs approximately $25-$35 CAD, depending on the time of day and traffic.

**3. Public Transit (Bus and SkyTrain):**
This is a more affordable option, but it takes a bit longer. You can take the Canada Line SkyTrain from the airport to the Oakridge-41st Avenue Station, then transfer to bus #99 (UBC B-Line) or #25 (Brentwood Station/UBC). The total travel time is around 45-60 minutes, and the cost is approximately $9-$10 CAD (depending on the time of day).

Here's a step-by-step guide:

* From the airport, follow signs to the Canada Line SkyTrain station.
* Take the SkyTrain towards Waterfront Station.
* Get off at Oakridge-41st Avenue Station.
* Transfer to bus #99 (UBC B-Line) or #25 (Brentwood Station/UBC).
* Get off at the University of British Columbia bus stop.

**4. Airport Shuttle:**
Several airport shuttle services operate from YVR to UBC, such as the UBC Airport Shuttle or the Vancouver Airporter. These services can be booked in advance and may cost around $20-$30 CAD per person, one way. The travel time is around 30-40 minutes, depending on traffic.

**5. Private Car Service or Chauffeur:**
If you prefer a more luxurious and hassle-free experience, you can book a private car service or chauffeur. This option is more expensive, with prices starting from around $60-$100 CAD, one way.

Whichever option you choose, make sure to check the schedules, prices, and travel times in advance to plan your trip accordingly.
